jsimple.net

Class HttpResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsimple.lang.AutoCloseable
      • jsimple.net.HttpResponse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JavaHttpResponse

    public abstract class HttpResponse
extends AutoCloseable
    This class handles http connectivity. It's based on a subset of the standard Java java.net.HttpURLConnection class, with some changes (to improve names, get rid of checked exceptions, etc.).

    From the doc for java.net.HttpURLConnection: Each instance of this class is used to make a single request but the underlying network connection to the HTTP server may be transparently shared by other instances. Calling the close() methods on the InputStream or OutputStream of an HttpURLConnection after a request may free network resources associated with this instance but has no effect on any shared persistent connection. Calling the disconnect() method may close the underlying socket if a persistent connection is otherwise idle at that time.

    This class is platform independent. Platforms (Java, C# for .Net, etc.) should define a subclass with the actual implementation.

    Since:
    10/6/12 12:58 AM

    • Method Detail

      • getStatusCode

        public abstract int getStatusCode()
        Gets the status code from an HTTP response message (e.g. 200, 401, etc.). Returns -1 if no code can be discerned from the response (i.e., the response is not valid HTTP).
        Returns:
        the HTTP Status-Code, or -1

      • getStatusMessage

        public abstract java.lang.String getStatusMessage()
        Gets the message from the HTTP response status line--the "reason phrase" (which is what the RFC calls it) describing the error that comes after the status code.
        Returns:
        the HTTP reason phrase, from the status line

      • getBodyStream

        public abstract InputStream getBodyStream()
        Returns an input stream that reads from this open connection.

        A SocketTimeoutException can be thrown when reading from the returned input stream if the read timeout expires before data is available for read.

        Returns:
        an input stream that reads from this open connection
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while creating the input stream

      • getHeader

        @Nullable
public abstract java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String headerName)
        Get the value of the specified header or null if the header isn't present.

        TODO: Handle multivalued headers by returning, in most cases, the first value--that's at least what the Scribe code does.

        Parameters:
        headerName - HTTP header name
        Returns:
        header value or null if not present
